My Projects .

Catacamp

Full stack web app for listing campsites in Catalonia

Try it

Guest - Guest123!

live website github

Main Features

(complete list in github readme)

  • Built with MongoDb, Express, NodeJS and Bootstrap 4

  • CSS: grid layout, card design, generic dark/light gradient, image zoom effect

  • JS: toggle password visibility in forms, copy url to clipboard and tooltip

  • Models: users, campgrounds, comments with user data association

  • User authentication: PassportJS Authentication

  • Password reset with email confirmation (Mailgun API)

  • Flash messages for user feedback with Connect-flash

Goudster

Commercial website for the beer brand Goudster

live website github

Main Features

(complete list in github readme)

  • Full project: from design in adobeXD, build in NodeJS (Express) to deployment on private server

  • Compliance: age consent modal on page load, GDPR compliant forms

  • Map with Google Maps API

  • Newsletter signup and contact form e-mail handling via Mailgun API

Travel Site

Fully responsive front-end website built to practice with SASS/JS file architecture, BEM naming conventions, icon sprites, Gulp, Webpack and the deployment process.

live website github

Main Features

(complete list in github readme)

  • JS/JQUERY: sticky header on scroll, animated hamburger menu, full screen modal, reveal elements on scroll (Waypoints), lazy loading images (LazySizes), smooth scrolling to page section

  • CSS: column layout with floats and flexbox

  • HTML: responsive images with data-srcset attributes

Todo App

Single Page todo-app with custom JSON API

live website github

Main Features

(complete list in github readme)

  • controller: Nodejs (Express), model: MongoDb & Mongoose

  • AJAX with jQUERY

  • taskrunner: gulp (nodemon+browserSync; minification, autoprefixer, babel)

Cooking React

Basic front-end react app for recipes

live website github

Main Features

(complete list in github readme)

  • Create react-app in Nodejs with localStorage

  • Recipes can be searched/added/edited/deleted

  • The changes made in the edit section immediately show up in the recipe list section

I am a self-taught developer. Some material I used and recommend:

  • For most of my development I rely on a windows machine with Visual Studio Code and Git Bash. I'd also been working with Linux Mint for a couple of years prior to learning web development and that is a good way to get familiar with the command line and Ubuntu-based servers.

  • My go-to hosting providers are Digital Ocean (VPS) and Versio (Wordpress), plus Netlify for automated deployment of front-end apps.

  • Learn Javascript with the open source Modern Javascript Tutorial and the book written by Marijn Haverbeke: Eloquent Javascript: A modern introduction to programming

  • Udemy courses: 'The Web Developer Bootcamp' and 'The Advanced Web Development Bootcamp' by Colt Steele. Some of the material may be outdated but dealing with outdated packages and unexpected errors without the help of an instructor is a good learning experience.

  • Learning React: see official docs Thinking in React and Web Dev Simplified by Kyle Cook

  • For problem solving, inspiration and references use stack overflow, css-tricks.com and Mozilla Developers Network(MDN). Discover front-end design tricks on youtube with Gary Simon (Coursera) and Kevin Powell. For computer science related video's see Computerphile. Engineer Man also has excellent back-end and general programming video's. Finally, Coding Tech will keep you up-to-date with tech conferences from all around the world.
